question: Which one of the following statements is not correct regarding Certiorari?
option1: A High Court can issue a writ against itself in its administrative capacity.
option2: A bench of a High Court can issue a writ to another bench of the same High Court.
option3: A High Court cannot issue a writ to another High Court.
option4: A High Court can issue certiorari to a tribunal situated within its jurisdiction.
answer: A bench of a High Court can issue a writ to another bench of the same High Court.
explanation: A bench of a High Court can issue a writ to another bench of the same High Court is not correct regarding certiorari because it is issued by a higher court to a lower court or tribunal either to transfer a case pending with the latter to itself or to equash the order of the latter in a case.
